name: Remy Russell
Summary: Understand the users, buyers, and the problems worth solving to ensure success of the business
Inspire cross-functional collaboration to align on the most promising strategies
Drive the execution of the vision through rapid iteration of discovery and delivery with engineering partners

professionalExperience.description: Product Lead on the Platform and Interoperability teams for a Case Management platform used by social service providers (Homeless Management, Medically Tailored Meals, Behavioral Health, Enhanced Care Management, and more)
highlights: Partnered with internal and external customers and engineers to iterate and release new product features, including a RESTful API, a mobile-responsive web app for service recipients, various tools to support no-code or low-code integration design, platform improvements such as SSO and 2-Step Verification, scheduled file exports, and more
Elicited feedback to prioritize valuable initiatives, evolving the platform’s integration capabilities
Analyzed APIs and integration specs to define technical requirements for engineering teams
Managed stakeholder communication and owned relationships with external users and partners
Facilitated agile ceremonies (sprint planning, backlog refinement, retrospectives) to drive delivery
Maintained the roadmap, set KPIs, and leveraged feedback/data for continuous improvement
achievements: Helped drive growth in ARR from 10M to 15M by expanding features, supporting/improving implementation processes, and increasing platform interoperability, ultimately leading to CaseWorthy's acquisition of Eccovia
Shipped a new RESTful API from 0 to 1 and onboarded over 10 customer organizations to start using it for their custom integration use cases
Helped establish a Product Catalog and a platform-based, microservice approach to solving new problems in a way that enabled future growth/expansion

Lead new growth intiatives and gained experience shipping and/or scrapping MVPS to integrate with third parties to extend user capabilities (e.g. Twilio for Email & SMS, Onfleet and WorkWave for last-mile delivery operations, Health Information Exchanges, Medicaid Payers, external data warehouses, etc.)

professionalExperience.position: Business Analyst II, MMIS Implementation Project
professionalExperience.description: Worked with internal team and stakeholders from the Utah Department of Health on system migration and gap analysis activities for implementation of a Medicaid Management Information System ...
highlights: Partnered with the State customer stakeholders to define and document comprehensive design details for the Provider Enrollment Subsystem (to guide development and testing)
achievements: Improved project efficiency by streamlining gap analysis processes

professionalExperience.description: Learned the end-to-end functionality of CNSI’s 'Electronic Medicaid Incentive Payment Program' solution and re-authored technical documentation to comply with standards ...
highlights: Analyzed program mandates published by the Center for Medicaid Services to design and implement compliant functionality
achievements: Enhanced documentation accuracy, reducing compliance issues by 15%

education.degree: BSE in Industrial & Operations Engineering, Certificate in Entrepreneurship 2015
education.coursework: Relational database design, computer programming, process improvement, modeling, simulation, statistical analysis, decision analysis, lean management, business development, and mmore

Problem-solving and ownership of complex challenges
